domains.name: Experience Design
domains.description: Artifacts and specifications that define how users achieve goals through end-to-end tasks, flows, interactions, screen structures, states, and transition rules before visual UI implementation.

terms.name: User Goals
terms.definition: A structured description of what users aim to achieve when interacting with the Product, providing intent behind User Tasks.
terms.description: Defines user intent and desired outcomes that guide task definition, flow structure, and interaction decisions.

terms.name: User Task Inventory
terms.definition: A structured list of all tasks users must be able to perform within the Product, where each task represents a complete user objective.
terms.description: Enumerates user objectives the Product must support, creating a coverage baseline for flows, screens, and interaction specifications.

terms.name: User Flow Diagram
terms.definition: A detailed representation of the sequence of steps a user follows to complete a specific User Task, including alternate paths and decision branches.
terms.description: Defines end-to-end step sequences and branching needed to complete a task, enabling deterministic navigation and interaction behavior.

terms.name: Alternate Paths
terms.definition: Alternative sequences of user actions or system responses that allow a User Task to be completed differently from the primary path.
terms.description: Defines valid variations that still complete the same task objective without entering error or exception handling.

terms.name: Decision Points
terms.definition: Explicit branching moments in a User Flow where different user actions or system conditions lead to different outcomes.
terms.description: Marks where flow branches occur and what conditions or actions cause each branch, ensuring full coverage of paths.

terms.name: Trigger and Condition Mapping
terms.definition: A structured representation of triggers and conditions that determine transitions between interactions, states, or screens.
terms.description: Defines what event initiates a change and what must be true for the change to occur, enabling deterministic transition logic.

terms.name: Interaction Specification
terms.definition: A structured description of system behavior in response to user actions, including triggers, conditions, states, transitions, and outputs.
terms.description: Defines interaction-level behavior as an executable contract, covering what happens after each action under each relevant condition.

terms.name: Screen Structure Map
terms.definition: A layout definition identifying functional regions of each screen without visual styling.
terms.description: Defines functional zones and information/action placement at a structural level to support flows and interactions before UI styling.

terms.name: Screen Behavior
terms.definition: A detailed description of how each screen responds to user actions, system conditions, and navigation events at the page level.
terms.description: Defines page-level response rules, including what updates, what blocks, and what transitions occur under each condition.

terms.name: Screen Variants
terms.definition: Alternative screen representations that appear under different conditions such as device type, data availability, or user role.
terms.description: Defines how a screen changes structure or content under different conditions while preserving the task and flow logic.

terms.name: Low Fidelity Wireframe
terms.definition: A schematic representation of a screen showing placement and hierarchy of elements required to support a User Flow, focusing on structure rather than styling.
terms.description: Visualizes screen structure to validate flow support and information hierarchy without committing to visual design choices.

terms.name: Transition Sketches
terms.definition: Simplified visual representations of transitions between screens or states that capture movement or conditional shifts without high-fidelity UI detail.
terms.description: Illustrates how users move between screens or states to validate continuity and conditional transitions before UI-level animation decisions.

terms.name: Flow Consistency Review
terms.definition: A structured evaluation ensuring User Flows align with Requirements, Interaction Specifications, and System Logic to detect contradictions or gaps.
terms.description: Validates that flows, interactions, and expected behavior do not conflict and that all paths are consistent and implementable.

terms.name: Experience Completeness Review
terms.definition: A holistic assessment verifying that all necessary User Tasks, Flows, Interactions, Screen Structures, and Wireframes have been defined with no missing experience parts.
terms.description: Checks coverage across tasks, flows, and screens to ensure no user objective or interaction segment is undefined before UI and build work begins.

terms.name: Screen State Model
terms.definition: A structured definition of allowed screen states and their transitions, including conditions and required UI responses per state.
terms.description: Defines states such as loading, empty, error, populated, disabled, and readonly, including allowed transitions to ensure deterministic implementation and testing.

terms.name: Navigation Rules
terms.definition: A set of constraints defining allowed and forbidden navigation transitions between screens and states, including back-navigation and deep-link behavior.
terms.description: Defines which transitions are permitted, how back and forward navigation behaves, how direct entry is handled, and what must happen on refresh.

terms.name: Error and Empty State Definitions
terms.definition: A structured specification of user-visible behavior when data is missing, invalid, unavailable, or when an operation fails.
terms.description: Defines how errors and empty results are presented and handled, including recovery actions, messaging intent, and state transitions.

terms.name: Role-Based Experience Rules
terms.definition: Constraints defining how User Tasks, flows, screen behavior, or screen variants change based on user role, permissions, or access level.
terms.description: Defines what is visible, actionable, or reachable for each role, ensuring consistent experience behavior aligned with access control intent.

terms.name: Experience Persistence Rules
terms.definition: Constraints defining what experience state is persisted, restored, or recalculated across refresh, reconnect, restart, or session changes.
terms.description: Defines which values and progress are saved and how recovery behaves after interruptions, guiding frontend state management and API expectations.
